etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Nature: a weekly journal of science. From French autocollimation from auto- + collimation

definitions: The procedure of passing a beam of light though a converging lens on to a plane surface that reflects it back the way it has come (initially as a parallel beam); the use of an autocollimator; an instance of this.

notes.text: The procedure is used for purposes such as ascertaining the angle of a reflecting surface and measuring the alignment of machine parts.
